title: Border Patrol agents say 'time to get aggressive' in footage that contradicts claims against Marimar Martinez
desc: Martinez is expected to announce a new lawsuit stemming from her Oct. 4 shooting by a Border Patrol agent at a press conference Wednesday. Her attorneys say newly released evidence will show an agent lied to the FBI about firing five shots into her front windshield.

title: Commentary | DA eyes higher tariffs on sugar substitutes
desc: Higher tariffs may raise sweetener costs slightly, but large consumer brands are well placed to absorb or pass on the impact.

title: Sheng Siong shares down 3.9% at midday after OCBC downgrade
desc: The stock’s forward price-to-earnings ratio is more than two standard deviations above its historical average

title: Late Barbie Hsu’s Family Lashes Out At Alleged “Legal Battle” With DJ Koo Over $30M+ Inheritance
desc: Amid reports of an inheritance dispute involving DJ Koo, the family of his late wife, Barbie Hsu, has lashed out and pushed back against the claims.

title: minister Nakiwala roots for refugee support as aid
desc: Nakiwala Kiyingi says there is an urgent need to prioritise support for refugees to help them attain self-reliance, freedom and dignity as they seek refuge in Uganda.

title: Baileys launches Valentine’s pop-up in Kam
desc: The activation runs until Saturday, February 14, offering consumers a unique gifting experience.

title: More fire injuries and EV blazes in 2025; nearly half of emergency calls involved seniors: SCDF
desc: SCDF reports increased fire fatalities, a rise in EV fires, and nearly half of emergency calls involving seniors in their 2025 statistics. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Food noise: Are you constantly thinking about food?
desc: This constant preoccupation with food can contribute to weight gain and undermine weight-loss efforts.

title: Fires involving active mobility devices down 26.9% in 2025; total number of fires up slightly: SCDF
desc: The overall number of fires rose 3 per cent to 2,050 last year.

title: The R33 Nissan Skyline GT-R R400 Broke Japan's Horsepower Agreement
desc: Remember the JDM gentleman's agreement? Nissan clearly didn't bother with it because they produced a hardcore variant of the R33 GT-R in the 90s.
